column5: Check out Witchbay Camp. It is half way between Sioux Narrows and Kenora. It's a drive to camp that is totally focused on fishing. Good luck

I am looking to take a week trip to Canada this fall (Sept.)and would like to fish the great Lake in the Woods area. Can anyone give me a few ideas as to where to go that are not to expenseive place to stay. The group of guys that I going with likes to go with the housekeeping plan. I also have my own boat,looking for best deal for bringing it with me. Would like to stay in the Nester Falls area or if you have a better area let me know.Thank in advance Jeffster

Try the Sioux Narrows area only a 20min north of Nestor Falls and has some great fishing as well as great people. Try Motlongs Rod and Reel its right in town and has great rates.http://www.rodandreelresort.com/
Try Arrowhead Camp and Motel Ph. 807-484-2132
Try WhiteFishBay Camp @ WWW.Whitefishbaycamp.com. I think that you will like what you see.
Try Sunset Cove at Nestor Falls its one of the nicest places at Nestor Falls.www.sunsetcove.f2s
Young's Wilderness Camp in Steven's Bay just outside of Nester Falls. About a 10 minute boat trip to the resort. Ask for Perry. Nice folks and Perry hunts Muskies. Good LuckLane
[font size="1" color="#FF0000"]LAST EDITED ON May-10-01 AT 03:01PM (CST)[/font][p]top

Check out my site www.lyberghomes.com I have a nice place and great location. Cabin is modern and fishing is usually good! I'll even mark some hotspots for you. Sept. is pretty much open. A inexpensive way to go!!

WE have fished Nestor Falls for the last 15 years and have stayed at Sunset Lodge which is on Lake of the Woods, Housekeeping cabins, quiet bay, and priced right. Arrowhead is a decent place but is on the small lake that runs falls into LOTW, is less money, decent lake to fish, but would need to trailer your boat when on LOTW. You will really enjoy the mid to late september fishing as it has never dissappointed us. Crappie, walleye, Northern, and Muskie - you can catch them all.Hilliars Resort right at the Falls is a nice place, but probably full. Give me an email if you wish, we will be at Sunset september 15th.
Thanks for all the info. They all sound great and I can't wait to go. jeffster
